conclusion: Use the ideal gas law PV = nRT to find the temperature of the gas in state B.
Temperature at state A is 27 °C, equivalent to 300 K.
Pressure at state A, P_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa; Volume at state A, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m³.
Calculate the number of moles n using P_A V_A = nRT_A.
Substitute known values: (3 x 10^5 Pa) x (1 x 10^-3 m³) = n x R x 300 K.
Pressure at state B, P_B = 2 x 10^5 Pa; Volume at state B, V_B = 2 x 10^-3 m³.
Use ideal gas law at state B: P_B V_B = nRT_B.
Substitute known values: (2 x 10^5 Pa) x (2 x 10^-3 m³) = (1/R) x R x T_B.
The temperature of the gas in state B is 400 K.
